trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Frankfort
There were no other sightings in Frankfort on or around April 1st 2010
divs: Sighting DetailsWe live up agaist a golf corse and I let the dog out in the evening and take time to look up at the stars. I observed a star-like object, roughtly 60 odd degrees (estimation)in the sky, moving in a Southeasterly direction. Steady speed and in a straight trajectory. a white light color. No contrail and definitly not meteorite. I tracked the object for about a minute and then it faded out to black. I assume that it was catching sunlight until it moved into the shadow of the Earth. It appeared to be at great altitude. Secondly, an object that catches sunlight at 10:30 pm in central Kentucky must be at extreme altitude. Do satelites move in a Southeasterly direction? Absolutely no aircraft marker lights. Speed was much faster that commercial aircraft. ISS is over central Africa. Anyone's thoughts would be welcome.
